title: Trump Jr. raves about Kanye's 'Jesus Is King': He 'is cracking the culture code'
text:
Donald Trump Jr. Donald (Don) John TrumpTrump Jr. sending copies of 'Triggered' book to Romney, top Democrats Transgender cyclist responds to Trump Jr. criticizing her women's world championship win Trump says he doesn't want NYT in the White House MORE gave Kanye West Kanye Omari WestKanye West says supporting Trump is 'God's practical joke to all liberals' Sessions says he still supports Trump despite ouster as AG Baldwin kicks off new 'Saturday Night Live' season by mocking Trump over impeachment MORE’s new album “Jesus is King” a glowing review on Twitter Monday, calling the project “the epitome of fearless creativity and ‘dangerous, unapproved’ ideas.”

Kanye West is cracking the culture code.@kanyewest’s new album #JesusIsKing is the epitome of fearless creativity and “dangerous, unapproved” ideas.



Leftists always try to silence those who are speaking truth. They’re waging a war on our family and culture.



Kanye is a pioneer pic.twitter.com/EmPgLqgGZJ — Donald Trump Jr. (@DonaldJTrumpJr) October 29, 2019

ADVERTISEMENT

West, who has gotten backlash over the past few years for his vocal support for President Trump Donald John TrumpJudge schedules hearing for ex-Trump aide who refused to appear in inquiry READ: Army officer to tell investigators he twice reported concerns over Trump's Ukraine dealings Murkowski, Collins say they won't co-sponsor Graham's impeachment resolution MORE, released the album on Friday.

In an interview the day before, West said his support for the president is “God's practical joke on all liberals.”

"This shows you that God is hilarious. ... God has got a sense of humor. Liberals love art, right, and now, I am unquestionably, undoubtedly the greatest human artist of all time. It's just not even a question anymore at this point. It's just a fact, right?" West said.

"So, for the greatest artist in human existence to put a red hat on was God's practical joke on all liberals like, 'Nooooo not Kanye,'" he continued.

The rapper also said that "there will be a time when I will be the president of the U.S.”
description: Donald Trump Jr. gave Kanye West’s new album “Jesus is King” a glowing review on Twitter Monday, calling the project “the epitome of fearless creativity and ‘dangerous, unapproved’ ideas.”
